content:
Add Quick Actions to the Case Page Layout for Lightning Experience

Make actions available to your agents by adding them to the Salesforce Mobile and Lightning Experience Actions section in the case page layout.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience, Enterprise, Essentials, Performance, Unlimited, Developer Editions

USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To edit a page layout:	Customize Application

Add standard actions and custom actions to the page layout. When you create a custom action, it appears in the palette.

Drag actions from the palette to the page layout.

IMPORTANT You can add an LWC quick action to the highlights panel of a case record page if you create it as a dynamic action in Lightning App Builder.

From Setup, click the Object Manager tab. Select Cases, and then open the Case Page Layouts setup page.

Select the page layout that you want to add the action to, and then click Edit.

Click Mobile & Lightning Actions. Drag the action into the Salesforce Mobile and Lightning Experience Actions section, and then place the action where you want it to appear.

Save your changes.
title: Adding Quick Actions to Case Page Layout in Service Cloud
